desc.html:
$1 token issued at the 1962 Seattle World's Fair - "21st Century Exposition America's Space-Age World's Fair".

Seattle's skyline with the Space Needle is prominently featured on the front of the coin. On the back side is the coin denomination and details about the Fair. and on the back are details on the piece.

On the front near the base of the Space Needle are the small initials "AB" and on the same side of the coin, below the year on the right side is the initial "W" which stipulates where the coin was originally minted.

Front: "AMERICA'S SPACE-AGE WORLDS FAIR AB / CENTURY 21 EXPOSITION / SEATTLE / U.S.A. / 1962 W"

Back: "GOOD FOR ONE DOLLAR / IN TRADE DURING AMERICA'S SPACE-AGE WORLD'S FAIR / CENTURY 21 EXPOSITION / AT THE EXPOSITION GROUNDS OR AT ANY COOPERATING BUSINESS IN WASHINGTON STATE THROUGH OCTOBER 21, 1962"

This piece has a diameter of 1.5" and is made of brass.

wiki.Credit: I own the coin, photographed the front and back and spliced both images together in Photoshop
